Tom found his true passion by chance; a simple stop into a local flower store to buy some flowers for his mom. He later acquired the store along with valuable skills in event planning. Today, Kehoe Designs is a nationally recognized company and one of the largest event firms in Chicago, which thrives on design challenges and pushing the limits. He is known for transforming spaces into legendary events and one-of-a-kind galas, captivating partygoers with his food displays and sense of ambience for more than 17 years.

Kehoe Designs
Tom's Party Playlist

lighting is everything

One thing that can instantly improve any space is lighting. You can have a beautiful environment, but if the lighting is bad everything else suffers.

have fun with the unexpected

Tom doesn’t just shop Mariano’s for food and flowers. He’ll find fun things to use for decoration. Try kitchen and bath scrubbies to put underneath food trays like a ruffle.

start with color

It’s hard to know where to start when planning an event. Try something as simple as a color. Pick one as your theme and build around that with produce or whatever else inspires you.

Q & A

Which Mariano’s do you shop?

I shop at Mariano’s West Loop store and occasionally Mariano’s Lakeshore East. And on weekends I take my dad to Mariano’s Arlington Heights by his home.

How did you transition from flower shop to event designer?

It evolved over time from just flowers to include fabric treatments, lighting, stage design, furniture and more. As we grew, we added more capabilities to go with what we dreamt up.

What’s a popular event theme right now?

We’ve designed a number of events around the radiant orchid. It’s a really strong color, so we can use that rich magenta-purple-plum color story with linens, flowers, lighting, furniture – and saturate the whole event.

How do you approach designing an event like a wedding?

We try to capture an aspect of the bride and groom’s personality so everything from the rehearsal dinner to the wedding and reception has their signature on it.

What is your favorite flower and why?

I like Bougainvillea primarily for its rich color.

What’s an easy thing you can do to spice up a boring space?

Bring in natural elements like fruits and vegetables that bring in great color and texture. It adds an unexpected element that people naturally gravitate toward.

How do you make an average kitchen table feel classier?

Add a candle – or several – to the table to add warm light and make the meal feel special.

How important is music when hosting an event?

Music is critical and so is volume. I like to start music louder, then as more people show up and the noise level rises, I bring it down so guests can talk without shouting.

What’s the most important factor for hosting a successful party at home?

Two things. One – know your guests so you can cater to their needs. Two – stimulate all the senses – music, food, drink, lighting, decor. Make it a total experience.

Can you tell us about the flowers on the table in the video? How did you choose them?

Azure blue and white hydrangeas were the focal flowers, nestled into the design like little private gardens were clusters of muscari, deep blue delphinium, purple anemones, giant white phalaenopsis orchids and cascading vines of olives.

What's a good tip when trying to create your own centerpiece bouquet for a party?

Stick to oversized bright flower heads in petite vases/containers to give your table a pow of color with minimal effort in design and accessories for height.
